event: ingestion of two fresh tablets of Celphos (AlP)
IV magnesium sulphate 1 gm stat and 8 hourly
IV hydrocortisone 100 mg stat and 12 hourly
immediate gastric lavage with potassium permanganate (KMnO4)
activated charcoal was kept in the stomach, repeated 8 hourly
arterial blood gas (ABG) analysis showed a metabolic acidosis
metabolic acidosis correction was performed as per the protocol
shifted to an intensive care unit (ICU)
input/output was 3L/300 ml over the next 24 hours
IV amiodarone 150 mg bolus and infusion continued till the next 48 hours
normal sinus rhythm was maintained till discharge
BP was ranging from 70/50 mmHg to 90/60 mmHg
blood urea after haemodialysis was 70 mg/dl
urine output improved to around 1200 ml/24 hours
shifted to a step down unit (SDU)
liver and kidney functions were improving
